comment: Dr. Douguet is one of the best professors I have had in my life. He is outstanding as a person, but he is also a great lecturer. He is able to keep students entertained while also teaching very well. His tests were very similar to lecture and recitation information, and I recommend paying attention to both. The homework was not too bad either.

So far, my favorite class, I have taken. I had phys1 with probably the worst teacher ever then I got prof douguet for Phys 2 and he was a lifesaver. he cares about his students and gives probably the best lectures at KSU, overall one of my best prof.

Professor Douguet is a good, caring professor. PHYS 2212 is a very difficult course, no matter the professor. He has a bit of a strong accent, and can be difficult to understand sometimes. I relied on the textbook heavily for exams, but his lectures are thorough. Some extra credit is offered. Exams are T/F, MC, and FRQ. If in doubt, RIGHT HAND RULE

Physics 2 is a hard class no matter who you take, but professor Douguet is very passionate about not only Physics but teaching as well and wants to pass his passion of Physics to his students. He is very caring and always available after class and is willing to help anyone out who is struggling to get the material. If you can take him do it.

His course is asynchronous but recitation attendance is mandatory. Physics II is just so difficult. He is very responsive to questions and emails but he sort of made things more complicated, in my opinion. Reading the textbook will help clarify a lot. The homework assignments are quite difficult. But again, Physics II is HARD.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This course was asynchronous which was difficult b/c he posted around 5-6 lecture videos every week. I didn't make this class a priority b/c I didn't literally have to sit through a lecture, and therefore my grade was not what I wanted it to be. He's a sweet teacher and is willing to go over questions you have. He does give extra credit on tests.

Professor Douguet is a solid choice for Physics 2212. The exam difficulty is about average. Plus, he will give some extra credit problems after each exam that usually counts for 6-8%. He will expect you to understand the derivation of some formulas. Be sure that you can derive them because those types of questions will arise on exams.

Solid professor, phys 2 is a difficult class no matter who is teaching it but Douguet has a very clear teaching style and is always available to help outside of class if you need it. 4 tests total, gives a formula sheet and a "material for exam" prior to all the tests. Breakout sessions help review some test material as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Pop quizzes are given during the SI sessions. Lectures usually cover two to three chapters. There are about 10 homework assignments which are assigned on Webassign. His English is a bit difficult to understand. I wouldnt recommend to register for this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is a nice guy and cares about your grade. He says he doesn't curve but like he give extra credit that gives abt 2-4 pts which helps. The tests are 1/4 mc and 1/4 T/F and half free response(40pts usually). He is generous for partial credit. Not an Ez A but a B/C kind of class.
